name: human_services_data
title: Human Services Data Specification
description: HSDS describes data about organizations, the services they provide, the locations at which these services can be accessed, and associated details.

resources.name: organization
resources.description: The details about each organization delivering services. Each service should be linked to the organization responsible for its delivery. One organization may deliver many services.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for the organization. Each organization must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.title: Name
fields.description: The official or public name of the organization.

fields.name: description
fields.title: Description
fields.description: A free text description containing a brief summary about the organization. It can contain markup such as HTML or Markdown.
fields.example: Example Org is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing services to qualified beneficiaries

fields.name: email
fields.title: Email
fields.description: The contact e-mail address for the organization.

fields.name: website
fields.title: Website
fields.description: The URL (website address) of the organization.

fields.name: logo
fields.title: Logo
fields.description: A URL to an image associated with the organization which can be presented alongside its name.

resources.name: service
resources.description: The details of the services provided by organizations to a range of different groups.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for the service. Each service must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.title: Name
fields.description: The official or public name of the service.

fields.name: description
fields.title: Description
fields.description: A free text description of the service.
fields.example: Counselling Services provided by trained professionals. Suitable for people with mental health conditions such as anxiety, depression, or eating disorders as well as people experiencing difficult life events and circumstances.

fields.name: status
fields.title: Status
fields.description: The current status of the service which can be active, inactive, defunct, or temporarily closed.

fields.name: fees_description
fields.title: Fees Description
fields.description: A free text description of any charges for service users to access this service.
fields.example: Non-NHS patients are expected to pay for their counselling sessions. We charge a flat rate per hour of counselling. The current rate is £50 per hour. Please see our website for up to date prices.

fields.name: fees
fields.title: Fees
fields.description: DEPRECATED: Details of any charges for service users to access this service.

fields.name: minimum_age
fields.title: Minimum Age
fields.description: The minimum age of a person required to meet this eligibility requirement.

fields.name: maximum_age
fields.title: Maximum Age
fields.description: The maximum age of a person required to meet this eligibility requirement.

fields.name: assured_date
fields.title: Assured Date
fields.description: The date that the information about the service was last checked.

fields.name: assurer_email
fields.title: Assurer Email
fields.description: The contact e-mail address for the person or organization which last assured the service.

fields.name: last_modified
fields.title: Last Modified
fields.description: The datetime when the service, or any related information about the service, has changed. Should have millisecond accuracy.

resources.name: attribute
resources.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

fields.name: link_id
fields.title: Link Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

fields.name: taxonomy_term_id
fields.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

fields.name: link_type
fields.title: Link Type
fields.description: A code taken from an enumerated open codelist to indicate what the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or intended audience.

fields.name: link_entity
fields.title: Link Entity
fields.description: The table of the Link Identifier.

fields.name: value
fields.title: Value
fields.description: The value (if any) of an attribute.

resources.name: service_at_location
resources.description: A link between a service and a specific location.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the service at location entry. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: service_id
fields.title: Service Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the service at a given location.

fields.name: location_id
fields.title: Location Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the location where this service operates.

resources.name: location
resources.description: The locations where organizations operate. Locations may be virtual, and one organization may have many locations.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the location. Each location must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: location_type
fields.title: Location Type
fields.description: The type of location, which can only be postal for now.

fields.name: url
fields.title: URL
fields.description: If location_type is virtual, then this field represents the URL of a virtual location.

fields.name: organization_id
fields.title: Organization Identifier
fields.description: The organization identifier for a location. This is the organization that is responsible for maintaining information about this location. The identifier of the organization should be given here. Details of the services the organization delivers at this location should be provided in the services_at_location table.

fields.name: name
fields.title: Name
fields.description: The name of the location.

fields.name: description
fields.title: Description
fields.description: A free text description of the location.
fields.example: MyCity Civic Center is located on Main Street and contains facilities for a number of civic and community services available.

fields.name: latitude
fields.title: Latitude
fields.description: The latitude of the location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

fields.name: longitude
fields.title: Longitude
fields.description: The longitude of the location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

resources.name: phone
resources.description: The details of the telephone numbers used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for the phone number. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: location_id
fields.title: Location Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located.

fields.name: organization_id
fields.title: Organization Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number.

fields.name: contact_id
fields.title: Contact Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number.

fields.name: number
fields.title: Number
fields.description: The phone number.

fields.name: description
fields.title: Description
fields.description: A free text description providing extra information about the phone service
fields.example: Our main reception phone number. The phones will be available from 0800 (8am) until 1800 (6pm) local time. There may be some slight delays in answering your call if we are busy.

resources.name: contact
resources.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for the contact. Each contact must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: organization_id
fields.title: Organization Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact.

fields.name: location_id
fields.title: Location Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for the location of the contact.

fields.name: name
fields.title: Name
fields.description: The name of the contact.

fields.name: title
fields.title: Title
fields.description: The job title of the contact.

fields.name: email
fields.title: Email
fields.description: The email address of the contact.

resources.name: address
resources.description: The addresses of locations where organizations operate.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the postal address. Each postal address must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: location_id
fields.title: Location Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the location for this postal address.

fields.name: address_1
fields.title: Address line 1
fields.description: The first line(s) of the address, including office, building number and street.

fields.name: city
fields.title: City
fields.description: The city in which the address is located.

fields.name: region
fields.title: Region
fields.description: The region in which the address is located (optional).

fields.name: state_province
fields.title: State Or Province
fields.description: The state or province in which the address is located.

fields.name: postal_code
fields.title: Postal Code
fields.description: The postal code for the address.

fields.name: country
fields.title: Country
fields.description: The country in which the address is located. This should be given as an ISO 3361-1 country code (two letter abbreviation).

fields.name: address_type
fields.title: Address Type
fields.description: The type of address which may be physical, postal, or virtual.

fields.name: cityCode
fields.title: City code
fields.description: The city code when applicable. In France it's the INSEE code.

resources.name: schedule
resources.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for the schedule. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: service_id
fields.title: Service Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

fields.name: location_id
fields.title: Location Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the regular schedule

fields.name: valid_from
fields.title: Valid From
fields.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD,

fields.name: valid_to
fields.title: Valid To
fields.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD.

fields.name: timezone
fields.title: Timezone
fields.description: The timezone that all dates are expressed as, expressed as a UTC offset. Dates are assumed to be UTC otherwise.

fields.name: wkst
fields.title: Week Start
fields.description: iCal - The two-letter code for the day on which the week starts.

fields.name: freq
fields.title: Frequency
fields.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats.

fields.name: byday
fields.title: By Day
fields.description: iCal - Comma separated days of the week. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month; e.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month. -1FR is the last Friday

fields.name: opens_at
fields.title: Opens At
fields.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

fields.name: closes_at
fields.title: Closes At
fields.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.).

resources.name: required_document
resources.description: The details of any documents that are required in order to access or use services.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for the document. Each document must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: service_id
fields.title: Service Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the service for which this entry describes the required document.

fields.name: document
fields.title: Document
fields.description: A free text description of the document required to apply for or receive the service.
fields.example: Any official identification document (Passport, Driver's Licence, identity card) and evidence of address such as an official letter from local or national government. A driver's license which shows your name, photograph, and address can be used as a sole identification document.

fields.name: uri
fields.title: URI
fields.description: A web link to the document.

resources.name: language
resources.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: location_id
fields.title: Location Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

fields.name: name
fields.title: Name
fields.description: The name of the language in which the service is delivered.

fields.name: code
fields.title: Code
fields.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language.

resources.name: accessibility
resources.description: The details of the arrangements for access to locations for people who have disabilities.

fields.name: location_id
fields.title: Location Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for the location of the accessibility provision.

fields.name: accessible
fields.title: Accessible
fields.description: True if the address is accessible to person with reduced mobility

resources.name: taxonomy_term
resources.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

fields.name: code
fields.title: Code
fields.description: The term identfier as used in the taxonomy. This and the taxonomy_id combined define the term.

fields.name: name
fields.title: Name
fields.description: The taxonomy term itself.

fields.name: description
fields.title: Description
fields.description: A free text description of the term.

fields.name: parent_id
fields.title: Parent Identifier
fields.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

fields.name: taxonomy
fields.title: Taxonomy
fields.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

fields.name: language
fields.title: Language
fields.description: An ISO 639-1, or ISO 639-2 [language code](available at http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php) to represent the language of the term. The three-letter codes from ISO 639-2 provide greater accuracy when describing variants of languages, which may be relevant to particular communities.

fields.name: taxonomy_id
fields.title: Taxonomy Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the taxonomy containing the term.

fields.name: term_uri
fields.title: Term URI
fields.description: URI of the term.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier for the metadata description. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.title: Name
fields.description: The name for the metadata description.

fields.name: language
fields.title: Language
fields.description: The ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code for the language of the metadata description.

fields.name: character_set
fields.title: Character Set
fields.description: The character set of the metadata description.

resources.name: taxonomy
resources.description: The taxonomies from which taxonomy terms are taken.

fields.name: id
fields.title: Identifier
fields.description: The identifier of the taxonomy. Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: name
fields.title: Name
fields.description: The name of the taxonomy from which terms are sourced.

fields.name: description
fields.title: Description
fields.description: A free text description of the taxonomy.

fields.name: uri
fields.title: URI
fields.description: The URI of the taxonomy.

fields.name: version
fields.title: Version
fields.description: The version of the taxonomy.
